body:
In the moment, the pythran objects get converted into "normal" python objects in the last assignment in each line and copied back into pythran when used in the next line.

This PR fixes this by:
* adding pythran objects to the safe objects
* adding support for pythran in cmp and index during type interference
* added proper support for pythran in assignments

This was done during a sprint together with @scoder.

On a small benchmark on one of the numpy_pythran tests, a speed improvement of ~15% could be achieved (but this was just a small test).

commit.message: Added an equality and hash function for Pythran expr
Add pythran to the safe types
Make it possible to pass the type together with the index into _index_type_code, as this is needed during type interference
Restore the old behaviour and use index.type as the index type
Special handling for pythran expr in index nodes: return a pythran expr
Return a pythran expr when interfering the types in a compare node
Replace the content instead of calling the copy-assignment, which is not implemented

title: Type inference for Pythran expressions
